workflow.name: Generate weekly Twitter & Facebook performance reports with GPT-4o analysis
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate your weekly cross-platform social media analytics workflow with AI-powered insights. üìäü§ñ
 This system retrieves real-time Twitter (X) and Facebook data, validates and merges the metrics, formats them via custom JavaScript, generates a visual HTML summary with GPT-4o, stores structured analytics in Notion, and broadcasts key results through Gmail and Slack ‚Äî all in one seamless flow. Perfect for marketing, social media, and growth teams tracking weekly engagement trends. üöÄüí¨

## What This Template Does
 1Ô∏è‚É£ Starts on manual execution to fetch the latest performance data. üïπÔ∏è
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Collects live metrics from both Twitter (X API) and Facebook Graph API. üê¶üìò
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Merges API responses into one unified dataset for analysis. üß©
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Validates data completeness before processing; logs missing or invalid data to Google Sheets. üîç
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Uses JavaScript to normalize data into clean JSON structures for AI analysis. üíª
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Leverages Azure OpenAI GPT-4o to generate a professional HTML analytics report. üß†üìà
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Updates Notion‚Äôs ‚ÄúGrowth Chart‚Äù database with historical metrics for record-keeping. üóÇÔ∏è
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Sends the HTML report via Gmail to the marketing or analytics team. üìß
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Posts a summarized Slack message highlighting key insights and platform comparisons. üí¨

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Eliminates manual social media reporting with full automation.
 ‚úÖ Ensures clean, validated data before report generation.
 ‚úÖ Delivers visually engaging HTML performance summaries.
 ‚úÖ Centralizes analytics storage in Notion for trend tracking.
 ‚úÖ Keeps teams aligned with instant Slack and Gmail updates.

## Features
- Dual-platform analytics integration (Twitter X + Facebook Graph).
- Custom JavaScript node for data normalization and mapping.
- GPT-4o model integration for HTML report generation.
- Real-time error logging to Google Sheets for transparency.
- Notion database update for structured performance tracking.
- Slack notifications with emoji-rich summaries and insights.
- Gmail automation for formatted weekly performance emails.
- Fully modular ‚Äî easy to scale to other social platforms.

## Requirements
- Twitter OAuth2 API credentials for fetching X metrics.
- Facebook Graph API credentials for retrieving page data.
- Azure OpenAI credentials for GPT-4o AI report generation.
- Notion API credentials with write access to ‚ÄúGrowth Chart.‚Äù
- Slack Bot Token with chat:write permission for updates.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials for error logs.
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials to send HTML reports.

## Environment Variables
- TWITTER_API_KEY
- FACEBOOK_GRAPH_TOKEN
- AZURE_OPENAI_KEY
- NOTION_GROWTH_DB_ID
- SLACK_ALERT_CHANNEL_ID
- GOOGLE_SHEET_ERROR_LOG_ID
- GMAIL_MARKETING_RECIPIENTS

## Target Audience
 üìà Marketing and growth teams analyzing engagement trends.
 üí° Social media managers tracking cross-channel performance.
 üß† Data and insights teams needing AI-based summaries.
 üí¨ Brand strategists and content teams monitoring audience health.
 üßæ Agencies and operations teams automating weekly reporting.

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
 1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect all required API credentials (Twitter, Facebook, Azure OpenAI, Notion, Gmail, Slack, Sheets).
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Replace the username and page IDs in the HTTP Request nodes for your brand handles.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Verify the JavaScript node output structure for correct field mapping.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Configure the Azure GPT-4o prompt with your preferred tone and formatting.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Link your Notion database and confirm property names match (followers, likes, username).
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Add recipient email(s) in the Gmail node.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Specify your Slack channel ID for automated alerts.
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Test run the workflow manually to validate end-to-end execution.
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Activate or schedule the workflow for regular weekly reporting. ‚úÖ

nodes.name: Send Email Summary to Marketing Team

parameters.subject: =üìä Weekly Social Media Performance Report ‚Äî Twitter & Facebook Overview

parameters.text:
=Analyze the provided social media performance data and generate a clean, responsive HTML report styled for email ‚Äî modern, readable, and visually balanced. 
Include compact tables, soft separators, muted backgrounds, and accent color highlights.

Sections required:
1. Header section with report title and subheading.
2. Platform Overview Summary ‚Äî use subtle background and color-coded engagement highlights.
3. Top-Performing Posts (Ranked) ‚Äî use table with color rows and bold insights.
4. Engagement Trend Insights ‚Äî concise paragraph section with emphasis.
5. Content Gaps & Opportunities ‚Äî side-by-side platform-wise sections (Twitter vs Facebook).
6. Recommendations ‚Äî bullet format with icons or styled emphasis.
7. Footer note ‚Äî small text with timestamp.

All output must be clean HTML with inline CSS (suitable for Gmail/Outlook rendering).

Input Data:
{{JSON.stringify($json)}}

options.systemMessage:
=You are an analytics-focused HTML report generator. 
Your task is to create email-ready HTML with balanced spacing, aligned typography, and data-driven clarity.

Styling guidelines:
- Font: system or Arial, 14px base.
- Colors: #1E1E1E (text), #1263FF (primary accent), #F6F8FA (background), #EAECEF (borders).
- Headings: bold, #1263FF.
- Table headers: shaded background (#F2F4F7).
- Positive metrics: green (#22C55E), Negative: red (#EF4444).
- Use soft shadows, 12px rounded corners, and section dividers.
- Maintain consistent left alignment.
- Avoid unnecessary borders; use padding and spacing for clarity.

Ensure HTML renders cleanly inside Gmail (no external CSS or scripts).
Use subtle section transitions (<hr> or gradient separators).

parameters.content:
## Weekly Social Media Performance Reporter üìä  
This workflow automatically collects, analyzes, and summarizes weekly performance from Twitter (X) and Facebook into a visually formatted HTML report, then emails it to the marketing team.

### Core Steps:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch latest posts from both platforms  
2Ô∏è‚É£ Format and normalize post data (likes, comments, reactions)  
3Ô∏è‚É£ Merge both datasets for joint analytics  
4Ô∏è‚É£ Validate response integrity and log errors  
5Ô∏è‚É£ Generate a consolidated performance summary  
6Ô∏è‚É£ Use GPT-4o to create a polished HTML email report  
7Ô∏è‚É£ Deliver the report to marketing automatically  

### Setup Notes:
- Connect: Twitter OAuth, Facebook Graph API, Azure OpenAI, Gmail, Google Sheets  
- Verify Facebook page ID & Twitter user ID  
- Update email recipients and Google Sheet URLs  
- Test run before scheduling automation (e.g., every Monday morning)

## Data Fetching Layer  
Retrieves the most recent 20 tweets and recent Facebook posts from the configured pages/accounts.  
Pulls engagement metrics, media, and timestamps to serve as input for analysis.

## Data Formatting ‚Äî Twitter  
Processes raw tweet data into structured fields:  
- Expands hashtags, links, and media  
- Calculates impressions, likes, and retweets  
- Ensures consistent JSON formatting for analysis  
Prepares data for merging with Facebook results.

## Data Formatting ‚Äî Facebook  
Cleans Facebook API response, extracting message, reactions, image, shares, and engagement stats.  
Outputs structured post objects ready for aggregation and reporting.

## Dataset Merging  
Combines Twitter and Facebook formatted outputs into one unified data stream.  
Enables comparative engagement analytics and joint trend detection.

## Data Validation  
Ensures API responses are valid and contain the required fields before continuing.  
If missing or malformed data is found, errors are logged to Google Sheets automatically.

## Data Consolidation  
Aggregates merged data into a single structured summary object containing:  
- Total post counts per platform  
- Raw post arrays (Twitter + Facebook)  
This object is used as the AI input for report generation.

## AI HTML Report Generation  
GPT-4o converts structured JSON into a professional, responsive HTML email report.  
Sections include:  
- Platform overview  
- Top performing posts  
- Engagement trends & insights  
- Content gaps & recommendations  
Styled using inline CSS, optimized for Gmail/Outlook rendering.

## Email Dispatch  
Automatically sends the final HTML report via Gmail with subject:  
‚Äúüìä Weekly Social Media Performance Report ‚Äî Twitter & Facebook Overview‚Äù  
Ensures timely delivery of actionable insights.

## Error Handling & Logging  
Logs failed API responses or empty datasets into the configured Google Sheet.  
Provides visibility into integration reliability and API uptime.

main.node: Send Email Summary to Marketing Team

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
